full_text: Beas 2014/KER/215 IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM PRESENT: THE HONOURABLE MR.JUSTICE HARUN-UL-RASHID THURSDAY, THE 2ND DAY OF JANUARY 2014/12TH POUSHA, 1935 Cr1.MC.No. 30 of 2014 () (CC 537/2010 OF JUDICIAL FIRST CLASS MAGISTRATE COURT-I, THAMARASSERY) PETITIONERS/ACCUSED 1, 3 & 4: 1. MOIDEENKUTTY, AGED 36 YEARS $/O.AHAMEDKUNHI HAJI NOORIKARA VELLIPURATH HOUSE, KAREETTIPARAMBU MAHATPURAM P.O., KOZHIKODEDISTRICT. 2. MARIA W/O.AHAMEDKUNHI HAJI, NOORIKARA VELLIPURATH HOUSE KAREETTIPARAMBU, MAHATPURAM P.O., KOZHIKODE DISTRICT. 3. ASHIF HUSSAIN $/O.AHAMEDKUNHI HAJI, NOORIKARA VELLIPURATH HOUSE KAREETTIPARAMBU, MAHATPURAM P.O., KOZHIKODE DISTRICT. BY ADV. SRI.V.N.RAMESAN NAMBISAN RESPONDENTS: 1. FASLA D/O.HAMEED, PUTHANPURAYIL HOUSE, ANDONA RAROTH VILLAGE, KOZHIKODE DISTRICT, PIN - 673 573 2. STATE OF KERALA REPRESENTED BY THE PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT ERNAKULAM, PIN - 682 031. Ril BY ADV. SRI.PHILJO VARUGHESE PHILIPS R BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR SRI.PHILJO VARGHESE PHILIPS THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 02-01-2014, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: See 2014/KER/215 Cr1.MC.No. 30 of 2014 () APPENDIX PETITIONER'S EXHIBITS: ANNEXURE 1: TRUE COPY OF FINAL CHARGE REPORT DATED 8.7.2010 SUBMITTED BY THE SUB INSPECTOR OF POLICE, KODUVALLY. ANNEXURE 2: TRUE COPY OF DETAILED AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE 1ST PETITIONER AND THE 1ST RESPONDENT ON 17.12.2013. ANNEXURE 3: TRUE COPY OF AFFIDAVIT SWORN TO BY THE 1ST RESPONDENT ON 18.12.2013. RESPONDENTS' EXHIBITS: NIL //TRUE COPY// PA TO JUDGE Sel. pees 2014/KER/215 HARUN-UL-RASHID, J. Crl.M.C No.30 of 2014 Dated this the 2 day of January, 2014. ORDER Heard the learned counsel for the petitioners and respondents. 2. Accused Nos. 1, 3 and 4 in Crime No. 286 of 2010 of Koduvally Police Station, pending as C.C. No.537 of 2010 before the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court-I, Thamarasserry are the petitioners. The petition is filed seeking to quash further proceedings against the petitioners in C.C. No.537 of 2010 before the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court-I, Thamarasserry. 3. The offences alleged are punishable under Sections 406 and 498 A IPC. 4. The learned counsel on both sides submit that the disputes between the parties have been amicably settled and having regard to the resolution of the disputes between the parties, continuance of the criminal prosecution against the petitioners is an avoidable irritant. In view of the settlement arrived at between the parties, the Crl.M.C is disposed of quashing all further proceedings in C.C. No.537 of 2010 before the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court-I, Thamarasserry. Sd/- HARUN-UL-RASHID, Judge. scl.
